summary: Email chain among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing the July 24, 2019 incident where Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck. The emails focus on obtaining official reports about the incident and coordinating with investigators.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck on July 24, 2019; placed on suicide watch then downgraded to suicide observation.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cell mate who reportedly was threatened by Epstein.

connections.description: Epstein and Tartaglione were cell mates at MCC New York; Tartaglione reported being threatened by Epstein.

events.title: Epstein found with noose in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck. He was escorted to medical, assessed, initially placed on suicide watch, and subsequently downgraded to suicide observation.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell on July 24, 2019 at 0127 hours with a noose around his neck.
Epstein's cell mate reported being threatened by Epstein.
Epstein was initially placed on suicide watch and then downgraded to suicide observation.
The incident was under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.
U.S. Attorney's Office personnel were actively seeking official reports about the incident.
